### ------------------------------------------------------------
### TASK 1: Exploring Data Types in R
### Theme: Planet Aurora (fictional exoplanet)
### ------------------------------------------------------------

### 1.1. ATOMIC TYPES ----

# Numeric values (continuous)
gravity <- 9.8          # gravitational force (m/s^2)
temperature <- 27.5      # average surface temperature (°C)
radius <- 6800.3         # in kilometers
rating <- 8.9            # exploration rating (out of 10)

# Integer values (whole numbers)
moons <- 3L              # number of moons
cities <- 12L            # number of major cities
inhabitants_mil <- 45L   # number of inhabitants in millions

# Logical values (TRUE/FALSE)
has_water <- TRUE
is_inhabited <- TRUE

# Character values (text)
name <- "Aurora"
region <- "Andromeda Sector"
category <- "Class M Planet"

# Print description
cat("Planet", name, "in the", region, "is a", category,
    "with gravity", gravity, "m/s^2 and average temperature", temperature, "°C.\n")

### ------------------------------------------------------------
### 1.2. VECTORS ----

# 1. Numeric vector (combine numeric + integer)
numeric_vector <- c(gravity, temperature, radius, rating, moons, cities, inhabitants_mil)
print(numeric_vector)

# 2. Sequence vector (from 20 to 100 by 8)
seq_vector <- seq(20, 100, by = 8)
print(seq_vector)

# 3. Logical vector (10 random TRUE/FALSE)
logical_vector <- sample(c(TRUE, FALSE), size = 10, replace = TRUE)
print(logical_vector)

### ------------------------------------------------------------
### 1.3. MATRIX ----

# Create a 3x3 matrix with random numbers from -50 to 50
set.seed(42)  # for reproducibility
energy_matrix <- matrix(sample(-50:50, 9, replace = TRUE), nrow = 3, ncol = 3)

# Name rows and columns
rownames(energy_matrix) <- c("North", "Equator", "South")
colnames(energy_matrix) <- c("Zone_A", "Zone_B", "Zone_C")

# Show matrix
print(energy_matrix)

# Row and column averages
cat("\nRow Means:\n")
print(rowMeans(energy_matrix))
cat("\nColumn Means:\n")
print(colMeans(energy_matrix))

### ------------------------------------------------------------
### 1.4. LIST ----

aurora_list <- list(
  name = name,
  region = region,
  category = category,
  gravity = gravity,
  temperature = temperature,
  radius = radius,
  rating = rating,
  moons = moons,
  cities = cities,
  inhabitants_mil = inhabitants_mil,
  has_water = has_water,
  is_inhabited = is_inhabited,
  numeric_vector = numeric_vector,
  seq_vector = seq_vector,
  logical_vector = logical_vector,
  energy_matrix = energy_matrix,
  description = "Aurora is a Class M exoplanet with thriving life and moderate climate."
)

# Print list structure
str(aurora_list)

### ------------------------------------------------------------
### 1.5. FACTOR ----

# Create factor for population development stages
development_stage <- factor(c("early", "developing", "developing", "advanced", "advanced", "advanced"))

# Show frequency table
table(development_stage)

### ------------------------------------------------------------
### 1.6. DATA FRAME ----

# Create a data frame of major cities on Aurora
city_name <- c("Solara", "Vireon", "Mara", "Helix", "Nyra", "Kael")
population_mil <- c(12.5, 8.7, 7.3, 5.9, 6.8, 4.5)
coastal <- c(TRUE, FALSE, TRUE, FALSE, TRUE, FALSE)
stage <- factor(c("advanced", "developing", "developing", "early", "advanced", "developing"))

aurora_df <- data.frame(city_name, population_mil, coastal, stage)

# Rename columns
colnames(aurora_df) <- c("City", "Population_mil", "Is_Coastal", "Development_Stage")

# Display structure and summary
str(aurora_df)
summary(aurora_df)

# Add new derived column: population density index (fictional calculation)
aurora_df$Density_Index <- aurora_df$Population_mil * ifelse(aurora_df$Is_Coastal, 1.2, 0.9)

# Display final data frame
print(aurora_df)
